description: Redecoration to external facade and display of 1no. non illuminated new hanging sign
decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the repainting of the upper floor of the building in grey (RAL 7012 ), would lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of the listed building, which would not be outweighed by any public benefits. The proposal is therefore contrary to Paragraph 196 of the NPPF 2019, Policy 7.8 of the London Plan 2016 and Policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Officer comments: Details have provided of the signage at the entrance of the site. This would be appropriately located. Whilst the drawings are not at a scale of 1:5 or 1:10 as specified in the condition, officers are satisfied that sufficient detail has been provided to fully assess the signage in relation to character, design and highways matters.The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed and are hereby approved, subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to condition 43 (Detailed Drawings of Signage Board) of planning remission 21/03204/FUL, which states:Prior to installation, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:10 / 1:5 of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:- Signage boards etcThe developer shall submit a site plan / elevation and key plans / elevations where applicable associated with each detail identifying the location of each typical detail.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development

Fee required - The Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2023 has revoked fee exemptions for applications where decisions for a previous application were made after 5th December 2023.
